bib.title: Measurements Of Cross Sections For Radiative Captureof 1-Kev To 1-Mev Neutrons By Mo, Rh, Gd, Ta, W, Re,Au And U-238

free_txt: Neutron res.param. and radiative capture cross sections
of Gd
- analysis, cross sections Mo,
Rh, Gd, Ta, W, Re, Au, 238U
-   Mo, Ta, 238U cross sections
Electron linac.
BIB changes.
Converted to reaction formalism
converted to reaction formalism
BIB corrections.
Converted to new date formalism.
SD:updated to new date formats,lower case.
corrected according to last EXFOR rules and dict.
Page in Ref. 70HELSINKI corrected. BIB update.
Subents 23,24 were added.
BP: BIB update, added REL-REF and doi.
Large liquid scintillator viewed by photo-
multipliers.
Below 80 keV, flux determined using He3
proportional counters which were calibrated using
B-10(n,alpha) reaction.
Above 80 keV, flux determined relative to n-p
scattering using methane proportional counter.
Electron linac.
Photo-neutrons produced by 45-MeV electrons
on a tungsten-alloy target. Neutrons moderated in
lead or uranium and in polyethylene. B-10 filter used
to prevent overlap of low-energy neutrons from
different bursts.
Rh data from
the same facility.
The samples used for the capture measurements were all
high purity metal disks approximately 11 cm in diam.
and ranged in thickness from 0.1 to 0. 25 cm. Except
for the 238U sample which was composed of depleted
uranium (99.8% 238U), the isotopic composition of the
samples was that of the naturally occurring element.
Approved by author
data taken from private comm., Fricke, July
1970. Part of the data are presented in pdf-files
(see status in subents), others were received on
punchcards.
Corrected for detection efficiency, resonance self-
shielding, multiple scattering.
Correction for finite sample effects less than 15%
above 5 keV.
The overall uncertainty in the shape of the
cross sections is obtained from the following
energy-dependent components:
* statistical and systematic uncertainties in the
gamma-ray counts and neutron flux data (including
contributions from backgrounds);
* an estimated 20% uncertainty in the correction
applied at high energies for the effect of the
variation of the gamma-ray pulse-height distribution
with neutron energy;
* and estimated uncertainties in the corrections
applied for multiple scattering and resonance
self-shielding.
The major uncertainties in the normalization
of the capture cross sections are:
* the uncertainty (typically < 5%) in the absolute
capture probability determined from the areas of
resolved resonances;
* a 5% uncertainty from systematic errors in the flux
measurements;
* and an uncertainty (~ 5%) in the gamma-ray yield
at the matching region 2-8 keV due to a 20%
uncertainty in the determination of background
caused by neutrons scattered from the sample.
Time-of-flight. 230 m flight path.
below 80 keV
above 80 keV
